Review:
I stopped by on my way home from Arima Onsen.

I have never been to the university I graduated from, but at the suggestion of my daughter and her husband, I stopped by for lunch.

The premises, including the auditorium with the clock tower in front, felt the depth of history and nostalgia.

The lunch we had at the cafe terrace near the entrance was 600 yen, which was a great value.

I took my grandson by the hand and visited the Kyoto University Museum.

I didn't know college was so open.

Author: Nguy·ªÖn VƒÉn Chi·∫øn
Review: Needless to say, Kyoto University is the most prestigious, desired and well-respected university all over Japan. Last week I was given an opportunity to visit this school and it was such a marvelous experience. The school library is absolutely stunning with an unprecedentedly huge book reservation with books dating back to even 18th century, together with other departments of the libarary such as self-study area, entertainment area, discussion area, ect all equipped with modern technological paraphernalia. The school has an inhouse museum which looks good from the outside but unfortunately I could not visit and a bookstore which sells all kinds of books from constitutional laws, political economy to finance and magazines, including Forbes. The dormitory has many single rooms in which there are all necessary items a person need for a daily routine.  The canteen is clean and designed in such a way to promote privacy among individuals, foods are amazing. Classroom are large and lecturers are very inspiring though their English is not really good. The school campus is surprisingly large with trees all around. Students here are friendly, they even allowes me to videotape them playing live music.

The famous Seibu Kodo (Ë•øÈÉ®Ë¨õÂ†Ç) is close to the bus stop. The three stars are still there to memorize the alumni in the incident. The students' high level autonomy is seen in the self-organized  Yoshida dorm (ÂêâÁî∞ÂØÆ) and the students' clubs occupying the space in the campus.

Author: Senkan Koukuu
Review:
A huge school which is often cited as being Japan's second best, but also as 'the best' in some fields like Biology and Chemistry. I guess it depends on how who rate the schools but as far as pure research output is concerned, I think Kyoto University is probably the best in the Basic Sciences while Tokyo University is better in the Liberal Arts, Engineering and maybe Mathematics.
I think the students are also very awesome and open-minded. The guys and girls I met at Kyoto University were all very nice and amiable to foreigners.

Comparison aside, a few labs of Kyoto University are leaders in their field. This is a good school, and perhaps the best for a few fields if you want to study and pursue a career in academia and are interested in living in Japan. Unless you have a reason to live only in Tokyo, of course.

Author: saifur rahman
Review: Excellent Place to Visit

Author: Risa
Review: I visited a friend at Kyoto University for the first time. My first impression was that it was a peaceful place, perhaps because there weren't many students due to the coronavirus. Is it in a place like this? I thought it would be closer to the station. There are many bicycles, and bicycles are the main means of transportation. Kyoto University is the second largest university in Japan, and is a world-famous university with many famous people. However, I hear that there are many people who are too free or strange. Cosplay is often talked about during the graduation ceremony season. For some reason, at Kyoto University, there is a custom of wearing a costume to attend the graduation ceremony, and it is said that it is quite flashy. I was envious of the number of libraries. It is said that there are 48 rooms and 7 million books, which is appreciated by students. I didn't go inside the building, but it was so peaceful that I could feel that student life at Kyoto University, surrounded by many world heritage sites, must be fun.

Author: Nobu37 JAPAN
Review:
A relative has been hospitalized, but due to the prevention of corona infection, it is not possible to visit.
It seems that there is an automatic glass door from the ward to the room area, and you can talk through the glass, but I can't let a patient in the hospital talk in a place like this, so after all, I have no choice but to go home when I'm done with my errands.
It's not the hospital's fault.

Wi-Fi is flying, but the free is weak and cuts off every 30 minutes, so I bought a Wi-Fi ticket (2 weeks / about 1000 yen) at Lawson on the first basement floor and handed it over.
It seems that he was watching Amapura and Netflix brought in his iPad.
It's like a prepaid card, and you can use it by entering your ID and password.

The staff inside were all kind and helped reduce stress during the hospital stay.

Review:
Kyoto University was the venue for my son's technical college entrance exam.
For that reason, I thought I might never set foot in it, but I was able to enter the university.

There seemed to be an event, and people of various ages seemed to be walking around the site with the guide.

The exam day was Sunday, so I couldn't go to the school cafeteria, but I took a picture of the atmosphere.

I was able to see the history museum of Kyoto University slowly, and I was able to know the weight of history.

Author: situ hinn
Review:
The alma mater of former Dwango representative Kazuo Kawakami. Nobuo Kawakami proudly writes on Wikipedia that he graduated from the Faculty of Engineering. The other day, I had a conversation with the former NHK party leader and exposed the shame to the whole world. No, Nobuo Kawakami went to expose himself to shame. Nobuo Kawakami, flustered, repeatedly asked Mr. Takashi Tachibana the usual childish questions, showing off his low intelligence and lack of understanding. Even if it was a legal theory, this guy tried to get rid of the words and failed, and on the contrary, he was refuted. Nobuo Kawakami seems to take pride in his knowledge of the law, but his content is below amateur level, and it is unimaginable how bad it is.
It sounds long-winded, but his alma mater is Kyoto University. Since even such a low-intelligence person can graduate, if even elementary school students around here can't all enter with a little effort, it's a university at a level that doesn't make sense. Until now, I thought that Kyoto University was more prestigious than the University of Tokyo, but I must admit that my perception was a castle built on sand.

Author: suzuki mak
Review: A 43-year-old man who was admitted to the psychiatric department of the Kyoto University Hospital escaped from the hospital and committed suicide because his doctors failed to take measures to prevent suicide. The Kyoto District Court ruled on the 26th in a lawsuit seeking The presiding judge ordered Kyoto University to pay about 28 million yen in compensation and other expenses, arguing that it was foreseeable that there was a risk of suicide and that the hospital had violated its duty of care. sad üò¢

Review:
It was hot in the summer and winter, and I studied while wearing a coat in the winter. Nursing recently? The number of flashy students has increased, and the library is more crowded than before...
There is a 7-Eleven, so it's convenient, but the school cafeteria is cheaper, so I often use it even though it's far away. There is Tully's on campus.
When I bought Kyoto University goods for my relatives, they were delighted. My favorite is the Element Touch mug. The design seems to change from time to time. The jersey can also be used everyday (occasionally sold out)
The lady at the shop is kind enough to explain various things. There are various students and it is stimulating, but there are many bicycles and it is dangerous.
